interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Resurrection [VHS] Review Date: 2002/06/20 Store: Ellen Burstyn (Actor), Sam Shepard (Actor), Daniel Petrie (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: VHS Tape Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Amazon.com', 'Released at a time when psychic auras, near-death experiences, and Kirlian photography were all the rage among early New Age proponents,', 'Resurrection', "achieves a spiritual depth rarely found in Hollywood movies. In one of her finest performances, Ellen Burstyn stars as Edna McCauley, a transplanted farm girl who develops healing powers following an accident that left her widowed and paralyzed. Returning to her Kansas homeland, she attracts awe and controversy, performing healings while deflecting any pretense of religion. That's a risky position in the Bible belt, and even Edna's new beau Cal (Sam Shepard) responds with zealous incredulity, fearing what he can't understand while others embrace Edna with unquestioning faith. Through it all, Edna remains calmly resolute as the conduit of an extraordinary gift.", 'Sensitively written by Lewis John Carlino (', 'The Great Santini', '),', 'Resurrection', "tenuously mixes spiritual significance with John Ford's homespun tradition, but for the most part it works: Burstyn superbly conveys Edna's heartfelt determination, and both she and stage veteran Eva LeGallienne (in a rare and final film performance, as Edna's grandma) deservedly earned Oscar nominations. The movie dares to suggest that miracles reside within everyone, and that pure grace will manifest itself in unexpected ways. To that end, Richard Farnsworth is warm and wise in a brief but perfect role; Burstyn's final scene with Roberts Blossom (as her disapproving father) is a heartbreaker; and the film ends with an act of compassion that brings the story full circle as an affirmation of life's greatest mysteries.", '--Jeff Shannon'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Format': 'Color, NTSC, HiFi Sound', 'Contributor': "Ellen Burstyn, Tom Taylor (II), Daniel Petrie, Jeffrey DeMunn, Claudette Harrell, Carlin Glynn, Madeleine Sherwood, Tommy Splittgerber, Clifford David, Ralph Roberts, Sylvia Walden, David Calkins, Jessie Lee Fulton, Edith Mills (II), Don Michaelson, Penelope Allen, Lane Smith, Carol Williard, Edward Pflaum, Sally Bondi, James N. Harrell, William D. Wittliff, John Tillinger, Trazana Beverley, Harvey Christiansen, A.G. Mills, William Ellis Smith, Dan'l Terry, Richard Hamilton, Sam Shepard, Lois Smith, Bernard Behrens, Douglas G. Jacobson, Vernon Weddle, David Haney, Joshua Dean Stewart, Lou Fant, Jennifer McAllister, Ruth N. Straw, Pamela Payton-Wright, Robert W. Johnson, Richard Farnsworth, Therese East, Eva Mokry, Shane Sinutko, Eva Le Gallienne, George Sperdakos, James Blendick, Brett Lamar Turner, Ebbe Roe Smith, Roberts BlossomEllen Burstyn, Tom Taylor (II), Daniel Petrie, Jeffrey DeMunn, Claudette Harrell, Carlin Glynn, Madeleine Sherwood, Tommy Splittgerber, Clifford David, Ralph Roberts, Sylvia Walden, David Calkins, Jessie Lee Fulton, Edith Mills (II), Don Michaelson, Penelope Allen, Lane Smit… See more", 'Runtime': '1 hour and 53 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Director': 'Daniel Petrie', 'Run time': '1 hour and 53 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 18, 2000', 'Date First Available': 'January 27, 2007', 'Actors': 'Ellen Burstyn, Sam Shepard, Richard Farnsworth, Roberts Blossom, Clifford David', 'Studio': 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment'} Review Text: I love this movie. It is a sleeper. Ellen Burstyn is always in a thought provoking movie. I was glad to be able to find a copy to buy from Amazon and have it in my collection.
It is a great love story.... Review Title: Review of Resurrection Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Travel Yugoslavia:Adriatic Coast [VHS] Rated: NR Format: VHS Tape Movies & TV, Movies {'Format': 'Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Travel Series', 'Runtime': '30 minutes', 'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Run time': '30 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 13, 1991', 'Date First Available': 'September 29, 2006', 'Actors': 'Travel Series', 'Studio': 'Victory Multimedia C', 'Country of Origin': 'USA'} This is an older film made prior to the end of the war in '95.
However, the scenery is beautiful. Shows most of the larger cities on the Adriatic Coastline in what is now Croatia, with a few southern cities as well.
Good, basic information. Does not really show the magnificent beauty of the Adriatic Sea.
I do enjoy it and brings back the wonderful memories I have from my visit there in 2000.
Thank you for offering this video for sale. I hope you offer more on Croatia in the future. Adriatic Coast Dog of Flanders VHS David Ladd (Actor), Donald Crisp (Actor), James B. Clark (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: VHS Tape Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Director': 'James B. Clark', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 24, 1998', 'Date First Available': 'February 9, 2007', 'Actors': 'David Ladd, Donald Crisp, Theodore Bikel, Max Croiset, Monique Ahrens', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Producers': 'Robert B. Radnitz', 'Writers': 'Ouida, Ted Sherdeman'} I love the Dog of Flanders. I saw the movie of the same title made several years ago. Then at my library I found this older edition and was so pleased when I found it still in print and available .... The older edition is different abit from the newer version; however I love both stories.
It is a classic of the highest standards. The original book has a sad ending and I am glad the movies are more joyful!
Excellent movies for children to see, especially any children with artistic talent! Enjoy! profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user continues to show a deep passion for travel-related media with a focus on historical and scenic themes, while also embracing classic films that evoke strong emotional responses. A new interest in thought-provoking narratives has emerged, particularly those that include spiritual elements.

- **Preferences:** The user maintains a clear preference for VHS format, reflecting a nostalgia for vintage media and the physical experience of watching films.

- **Content Focus:** Enjoys travel documentaries and films showcasing geographical locations, particularly coastal areas. Their collection now includes classic dramas with deep emotional themes and intricate storytelling. 

- **Emotional Connection:** Values personal stories and memories associated with travel and film, favoring narratives that promote emotional depth, artistic appreciation, and uplifting themes.

- **Desire for More Content:** Expresses a desire for diverse materials that delve into specific regions while continuing to seek older films that tell compelling stories and explore emotional or spiritual experiences.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user tends to give high ratings, reflecting a positive approach to content that resonates with them personally. They appreciate well-crafted narratives, particularly those that blend deep storytelling with emotional and spiritual significance.

Overall, the user’s profile indicates a balanced appreciation for both nostalgic travel-related films and classic narratives that provide emotional richness and cultural insights.
